Trade/Device Name(s): BD PhoenixM Automated Microbiology System for use with the antimicrobial agent cefazolin (2-32 μg/mL) - Gram positive ID/AST or AST only Phoenix panels
Regulation Name(s): Fully Automated Short-Term Incubation Cycle Antimicrobial Susceptibility Devices
Specimen Type(s): Pure culture isolates of Gram-negative aerobic and facultative anaerobic bacteria
Pure culture isolates of Gram-positive bacteria (Staphylococcus and Enterococcus)
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System incorporating cefazolin (2-32 μg/mL) for antimicrobial susceptibility testing of Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria
Indications for Use Summary: For rapid identification and in vitro antimicrobial susceptibility testing by MIC determination of isolates from pure culture of aerobic and facultative anaerobic Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria of human origin, including Staphylococcus and Enterococcus, using panels containing cefazolin at 2-32 μg/mL
